title: Manchester United 'target shock move for Leeds United midfielder Kalvin Phillips'
text:
Manchester United are reportedly targeting a shock move for Leeds United midfielder Kalvin Phillips.

United coaches Mike Phelan and Kieran McKenna have both been on scouting missions to watch him in action in recent weeks, according to The Sun.

Phelan ran the rule over Phillips when Leeds faced Birmingham last week, before McKenna watched on during the clash against Preston North End.

Manchester United are reportedly set to make a move for Leeds midfielder Kalvin Phillips

United coaches Mike Phelan and Kieran Mckenna have watched him in action in recent weeks

However, United are likely to have to spend big money to land Phillips, who recently signed a new long term contract at Elland Road.

Leeds have already rejected one bid for Phillips, from Tottenham, and manager Marcelo Bielsa reportedly seeked assurances he wouldn't be sold.

The club's director of football, Victor Orta, made it clear to interested clubs that he wouldn't be leaving, but could face more interest if Leeds fail to win promotion this season.

The 23-year-old came through the club's academy before making his debut as a teenager in 2014 and has since gone on to make over 100 appearances for the club.

Phillips played the full 90 minutes as Leeds drew 0-0 with Sheffield Wednesday in Saturday's Yorkshire derby at Hillsborough.
description: Manchester United are reportedly targeting a shock move for Leeds United midfielder Kalvin Phillips after sending first team coaches Mike Phelan and Kieran McKenna to watch him.
